2.title: How to overcome our biases? Walk boldly toward them
2.subtitle: Our biases can be dangerous, even deadly — as we've seen in the cases of Michael Brown in Ferguson, Missouri, and Eric Garner, in Staten Island, New York. Diversity advocate Vernā Myers looks closely at some of the subconscious attitudes we hold toward out-groups. She makes a plea to all people: Acknowledge your biases.

2.title: Why Protests and Riots Work
2.subtitle: Riots are destructive, dangerous, and scary — but can lead to serious social reforms. To prevent more violent uprisings and protests, we need to take their causes seriously.

3.title: Diva By Cindy
3.subtitle: Diva is for a woman who wants: Beauty, Excellence and Elegance in her hair. "DIVA" stands for: Divine, Inspired, Virtuous and Annointed. Thank you for using Diva by Cindy... the secret to Longer, Healthier Hair.

products.name: Super-Gro Haridress

3.moreInfo: In this 90 minute workshop, coaches will have an interactive discussion on how to combat racial discrimination, champion moral courage and empower their programs to create positive change in their communities.

5.title: Intersectionality Matters! Podcast
5.subtitle: Intersectionality Matters! is a podcast hosted by Kimberlé Crenshaw, an American civil rights advocate and a leading scholar of critical race theory.

5.title: The Case for Reparations
5.subtitle: Two hundred fifty years of slavery. Ninety years of Jim Crow. Sixty years of separate but equal. Thirty-five years of racist housing policy. Until we reckon with our compounding moral debts, America will never be whole.

6.title: Esusu
6.subtitle: Forbes Under 30 social entrepreneurs, Nigerian-born entrepreneur Wemimo and his business partner Goel co-founded Esusu in 2019. The mobile platform helps individuals mostly from marginalized communities save money, access capital and build credit.

6.title: How to be an Antiracist
6.subtitle: This conversation with professor Ibram X. Kendi was recorded during the 2019 Aspen Ideas Festival in Aspen, Colorado. In it, he explores what an antiracist society might look like, how we can play an active role in building it, and what being an antiracist in your own context might mean.

7.title: Not all Black people are African American. Here's the difference.
7.subtitle: Black Lives Matter protests have opened up conversations about the history of privilege, racism, and the lived experiences and identities of black people in America. Now, the distinction between "Black" and "African American" has become a prominent conversation on social media.

8.subtitle: Garnette Cadogan on the Realities of Being Black in America

8.title: The symbols of systemic racism --- and how to take away their power
8.subtitle: Multidisciplinary artist and TED Fellow Paul Rucker is unstitching the legacy of systemic racism in the United States. A collector of artifacts connected to the history of slavery -- from branding irons and shackles to postcards depicting lynchings -- Rucker couldn't find an undamaged Ku Klux Klan robe for his collection, so he began making his own.

22.title: How we're priming some kids for college --- and others for prison
22.subtitle: In the United States, two institutions guide teenagers on the journey to adulthood: college and prison. Sociologist Alice Goffman spent six years in a troubled Philadelphia neighborhood and saw first-hand how teenagers of African-American and Latino backgrounds are funneled down the path to prison — sometimes starting with relatively minor infractions. In an impassioned talk she asks, "Why are we offering only handcuffs and jail time?"

26.title: Open Yale Courses: African American History: From Emancipation to the Present
26.subtitle: The purpose of this course is to examine the African American experience in the United States from 1863 to the present. Prominent themes include the end of the Civil War and the beginning of Reconstruction; African Americans’ urbanization experiences; the development of the modern civil rights movement and its aftermath; and the thought and leadership of Booker T. Washington, Ida B. Wells-Barnett, W.E.B. Du Bois, Marcus Garvey, Martin Luther King Jr., and Malcolm X.

27.title: What Happened on May 25th?
27.subtitle: On May 25th, 2020, George Floyd was in Minneapolis on business, far from his family and community, when four Minneapolis police officers murdered him in broad daylight. It was a modern day lynching as those police officers served as judge, jury, and executioner on an unarmed, non-violent, handcuffed Black man.

27.subtitle: Yes, we sell granola (it's quite tasty), but more importantly, we want to inspire you to live your life with purpose, passion, and to follow your dreams. Our products are here to bring the adventure back to snacking, and better yet, celebrate YOU when those dreams are achieved.

products.name: Original Recipe
products.description: The Original Recipe blend has a sweet caramel flavor that makes it simply delicious. There are so many ways to enjoy this treat--topping on your yogurt, adding some crunch to your favorite ice cream, or creating a crust for a cheesecake.

products.name: Lemon Bar
products.description: Lemon Bar will please the palate of all lemon lovers and add a refreshing flavor to a bowl of oatmeal or a new bite to your favorite cheesecake recipe.

products.name: Caribbean Delight
products.description: Caribbean Delight is our first vegan product. The ingredients include coconut oil, grated coconut, and a touch of raisins that will make your palate dance. Not to mention, you will immediately be reminded of that time you went on an island vacation.

28.title: Cultures, nations, and religions are not rocks – they’re always changing
28.subtitle: Learn more about Destiny Instinct. Failing to understand it blinds us to the revolutionary transformations in societies happening all around us.

28.title: Know Your Rights Camp
28.subtitle: Colin Kaepernick's organization's mission is to advance the liberation and well-being of Black and Brown communities through education, self-empowerment, mass-mobilization and the creation of new systems that elevate the next generation of change leaders.

29.title: Just Mercy: A Story of Justice and Redemption
29.subtitle: An unforgettable true story about the potential for mercy to redeem us, and a clarion call to end mass incarceration in America — from one of the most inspiring lawyers of our time.

29.title: Buttaz & Wax
29.subtitle: Buttaz & Wax is a handcrafted body butter and personal care line that came about after founder Keisha Marie made one of her body butters and her eight year old daughter looked up at her and said "mommy these are good, you should sell them".

products.name: Coco Loco Body Butter
products.description: Apply to any area of the body as needed. Best used after a shower when skin is still a bit damp. The butters and oils will lock moisture from shower into your skin.

products.name: Beard Oil
products.description: Work 3-5 drops of our beard oil into your hair revive your beard. Best used right after a shower while your beard is still damp

products.name: Lavender Soap
products.description: Our Lavender handcrafted soap, just like our Lavender bathsalts, smells like calming Lavender.

30.title: Register to Vote
30.subtitle: Register to vote to make your voice heard and make sure the people we elect to positions of power have the best interests of every American in mind.

30.title: RayTec Audio
30.subtitle: RayTec, wherever you go, your soundtrack should follow. Music has changed the world. It's a form of expression and should be heard at the highest, premium level. When you hear music that you like, when you're listening to a book of your choosing, you get excited, or motivated or you may become active.

products.name: RayTec Airpods
products.description: Ideal for hands free activities: Exercising, phone calls, music, working, audio books, and tuning the world out!

products.name: RayTec Watch6 — Black Case
products.description: Make bluetooth calls through your watch for hands free communication. Read messages and notifications through this watch: Facebook, Instagram, Whatsapp and more.

products.name: RayTec-C10 Headphones
products.description: Comfy on the ears, Adjustable to fit on your head, Foldable, Chargeable, Super bass
